entries.title: Kathy Hochul announces gas stove ban in new bid to push New Yorkers to Florida
entries.description:
A few days ago, news broke that the Biden administration may be planning a nationwide ban on gas stoves. After facing widespread backlash from stove enthusiasts across the country, Biden ruled the ban out as a possibility.

New York Governor Kathy Hochul, however, can't seem to take a hint. During her State of the State address, Hochul announced bans on gas stoves, as well as oil furnaces and hot water heaters in commercial construction and new homes. The bans are part of "The New York Housing Compact," which is supposed to build 800,000 new homes over the next ten years to address New York State's historic housing shortage.

\u201cKathy Hochul moves to ban gas stoves in New York\n\nhttps://t.co/876CCyKpNw\u201d
— The Post Millennial (@The Post Millennial) 1673549411

This is the same state that just faced a historic blizzard in Buffalo which left some residents without power, food, or heat for days on end. Do you know what's really handy to have during a blizzard that causes power outages and closes all supermarkets? A gas stove.

Not to mention, a gas stove ban would have a detrimental impact on restaurants. Restauranteur Stratis Morfogen told Tucker Carlson a ban on gas stoves would drop productivity by 40%, increase bills sixfold, and overall destroy the restaurant industry.

\u201cThank you @TuckerCarlson @FoxNews for giving small business a BIG PLATFORM to fight GOVT over reach. https://t.co/WsMHcZD0t5\u201d
— Stratis Morfogen (@Stratis Morfogen) 1673408854

Unfortunately, Kathy Hochul infringing on the rights of her citizens is nothing new, which is a huge reason why so many New Yorkers have fled to Florida. Perhaps this asinine gas stove ban will push a few more down South.

Today, Governor Ron DeSantis made Florida's position on this issue very clear with brand-new "Don't Tread on Florida" gas stove signs.

\u201cWATCH: Gov. Ron DeSantis declares "you're not taking our gas stoves away from us," holds up a "Don't Tread on Florida" gas stove sign\n\n"We're gonna stand up for that [...] They start propagating the narrative, but then they got blowback, and they kind of had to retreat from it."\u201d
— Florida\u2019s Voice (@Florida\u2019s Voice) 1673537140

It's quite unfortunate America has reached the point of debating whether or not the federal government has the authority to regulate the appliances in your own home. But at least we can always count on leaders like DeSantis to meme on the feds.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: WATCH: Doocy confronts Biden on top-secret docs found in his garage. Biden: But I have a Corvette!
entries.description:
Well, it turns out, Biden's second batch of secret documents was discovered in the garage of his Delaware home. To me, this is the weirdest part of the story. No one reads top-secret information about geopolitical adversaries in the garage. That's gotta be at least a living-room activity.

Earlier today, Peter Doocy confronted Biden about his top-secret-document-placement choice, commenting that the highly sensitive documents were right next to his Corvette. Biden responded by noting his Corvette is in a locked garage. Which honestly isn't a bad defense. Corvettes are valuable. Maybe not as valuable as the security of American citizens, but still pretty darn valuable.

\u201cPeter Doocy on new batch of classified documents found in Biden's garage: "Classified material next to your Corvette! What were you thinking?" \n\nBiden responds: "My Corvette is in a locked garage, OK? So it's not like they're sitting out on the street"\u201d
— Ryan Saavedra (@Ryan Saavedra) 1673539160

After watching that exchange, I am prepared to present a theory that has absolutely zero substantiation other than I saw it on Twitter: that entire interaction seems like it may have been scripted. Doocy's delivery was a little cringe, and Biden seemed to have a scripted response that was ever so slightly more coherent than his usual scripted responses.

\u201cI am just gonna say this, but I have no hard evidence to back it up, just experience. This REEKS of a set up. There, I said it. Continue.\u201d
— Tracy Beanz (@Tracy Beanz) 1673548024

Doocy's question allowed him to address the issue publicly, but his answers were "Dark Brandon"-esque. He joked about his Corvette and could come off a little more like a cool Grandpa with a sick ride and a little less like a senile old man who doesn't know why he's in a white house or what all these cameras are for.

His PR team has been trying to push the "Dark Brandon" angle to cover up his less-than-stellar mental functions for a while now. Earlier this year, Deputy Press Secretary Andrew Bates tweeted out a Batman-inspired meme that reads, "The Dark Brandon Rises."

\u201c@SteveGuest\u201d
— Steve Guest (@Steve Guest) 1659919417

"Dark Brandon" may not be enough to shield Biden from the documents scandal, given that Merrick Garland just appointed a special counsel to investigate. The Democrats could also take this opportunity to "dispose" of Biden before 2024, given that he is heavily disliked by, well, pretty much everyone. But, this early on, it seems the most likely scenario is akin to the investigation into Hillary Clinton's emails, which yielded...nothing.

entries.title: Watch: World's dumbest shoplifter was so busy grabbing clothes he didn't notice the cops outside waiting for him
entries.description:
I know what you're thinking. You watch a multitude of shoplifting content on the internet and say to yourself, "Self, I can do that!" Well, maybe not YOU. If you're reading this, you know doubt have morals, and self-respect for yourself.

One man who has neither, but spends too much time on the internet, realized it's not as easy as it looks. You can almost hear the man thinking to himself, "yeah, I wasted my life" as he noticed a member of the law staring at him.

🤣 pic.twitter.com/g3sFLUN9AS
— Clown World ™ 🤡 (@ClownWorld_) January 12, 2023

Though as much as we enjoy watching knucklehead criminals get their comeuppance, the highlight is the vlogger's adorable daughter photobombing the camera. We've all been there. When my nieces and nephew see me with my phone out, they don't always understand "Uncle Brodigan is doing content."

As for the shoplifter, here's what I think happened. The man spends too much time on the internet, as I alluded to before. He's watched video after video after video of flashmobs stealing handfuls of clothes and waltzing out the door. Almost as brazenly as having the security guard open the door for them and wish them well.

It's not like my man here was sneaking a tie into his jacket pocket. He had two armfuls of trousers.

The rub is the videos he watches take place in progressive cities where progressive voters elect progressive politicians to enact progressive "justice" policies. A common policy has more or less made shoplifting legal up until $999. This guy obviously lives in real America where laws are still enforced. Because police were waiting for him as he attempted his escape.

I'm assuming this was a case of bad luck. You can't call the cops until the crime was committed. It just so happened the police were there on an unrelated matter and watched this dufus attempt to leave the store with his illegal contraband. The only thing missing is the cop saying "really, dude?" before telling him to turn around.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: OpEd: China's Afghanistan moves show isolation is a pipedream
entries.description:
You’ve heard the argument from the far reaches of each party, and while it varies slightly from Left to Right, the basic sentiment goes something like “America needs to mind its own business.”

The crux of this viewpoint, isolationism if you will, maintains that the world would be a much better place if America would simply stop involving itself politically, economically, and militarily in the affairs of foreign nations.

When a politician or diplomat pushes against this narrative by suggesting it’s in America’s interest to fund our allies or kill terrorists, they are castigated as warmongers. And if the figure in question is a Republican you can guarantee they will be tagged with the label “neocon.”

Take this tweet from self-described populist Ryan James Girdusky as a prime example. Responding to a tweet from Senator Ted Cruz in which he made the benign statement that supporting Ukraine was in America’s interest, Girdusky responded saying “Ted Cruz is a neocon who only supports neocons. If he endorses someone in the primary, it’s best to vote against them.”

Ted Cruz is a neocon who only supports neocons. If he endorses someone in the primary, it’s best to vote against them. https://t.co/w9wjdHTSYm
— Ryan James Girdusky (@RyanGirdusky) May 23, 2022

Another particularly amusing manifestation of this ideology is a map that went viral on Twitter, showing all the purported locations of American military bases near Russia, with the implication being that Russia was forced to invade Ukraine because of American encirclement.

The argument certainly isn’t reserved for the Ukraine discussion either. After all, if we shouldn’t care about Ukraine, why should we station troops in Germany, Korea, or Japan? Why should we provide aid to African and Middle Eastern nations? Of course, each of these particular circumstances varies drastically from one to the next, and I’m oversimplifying for effect. However, to the isolationist, the principle remains unchanged across the board. Why should America bother with the defense and economic support of foreign countries when we have more than enough problems to deal with domestically? Especially when our involvement abroad does nothing but cause mayhem and dissent.

Ironically, a major victory for these isolationists was in 2021 when Joe Biden abruptly pulled the United States out of Afghanistan. While many in that camp would have to concede the pullout was handled miserably, to them it was a necessity to remove America from what they call ‘forever wars.” Never mind the fact that at the time of the pullout, a mere 3,500 troops remained in the country, and that this small force was keeping the country stable. The idea of American involvement to any degree couldn’t be tolerated.

It's here we should address the naivete of isolationism as a worldview. Those that support the idea must also necessarily believe that American foreign policy exists in a vacuum or that American interests are so separate from those of the outside world that foreign events have no bearing on life in the United States.

This couldn’t be further from reality, as events in Afghanistan over the last year have shown.

Since the abrupt exit of American troops, Afghanistan has devolved at a rapid pace. On August 16, 2021, before the pullout was even complete, the Taliban took over as the official government of the country. Since then, they have instituted numerous draconian measures upon the Afghan people. A bulk of these are aimed at restricting women’s rights, including a formal suspension of education for women.

As gross of a fiasco as this is, it admittedly does little to harm America outside of its reputation as a champion of human rights. But it’s not the Taliban's draconian treatment of women that should most concern Washington. What should, however, is who the Taliban is making deals with.

Earlier this month, in its first energy extraction deal since coming to power, the Taliban signed an agreement with China's Xinjiang Central Asia Petroleum and Gas Company. The deal is a 25-year lease that allows the company to drill for oil in Afghanistan’s Amu Darya basin. Chinese state companies are also looking at investments in Afghanistan’s Mes Aynak copper Mines.

Furthermore, Afghanistan sits on roughly $1T worth of natural gas, copper, and rare earths, which Beijing is all too likely to exploit.

By haphazardly pulling out of Afghanistan the Biden administration essentially gifted China, America’s biggest geopolitical threat, an untapped treasure trove of resources and a strategic foothold in Central Asia. Lack of action by Washington in South America and Africa has also allowed Beijing to make strategic gains through investment and military cooperation.

China is now the largest trading partner of both South America and Africa, and in 2017 China established its first overseas base in Djibouti, with further plans for a naval base in Equatorial Guinea in the works.

These developments are certainly concerning to Washington considering China’s stated goal of challenging American supremacy globally.

The counterargument to isolationism is not that the US should indiscriminately involve itself abroad. In fact, both cases touched upon so far, Ukraine and Afghanistan, require nuanced debate as to the cost/benefit analysis of American intervention. There’s certainly an argument to be made that prolonged commitment to Ukraine will strain our resources and ability to handle more pressing issues, like China.

It is true that there are areas that are of more strategic concern to the United States, namely: Northeast Asia, Europe, and the Persian Gulf. To ensure we can credibly defend our interests in these regions, trade-offs will have to be made. American foreign policymakers are often too weak-stomached to address this reality.

However, there is little nuance or strategy to isolationism’s prescription. Should American politicians like Ted Cruz face tough questioning about the commitment of American soldiers and tax dollars abroad? Absolutely. But throwing around epithets like ‘warmonger’ and ‘neo-con’ at those who think that there are merits to American involvement in foreign causes is ignorant at best, and malicious at worst.

While it would be illogical to argue that American isolationism in the pre-WW2 era, led by figures like Charles Lindbergh, was directly responsible for the war itself, it would be equally illogical to say that it had no effect on the scale the war was allowed to reach. And while isolationism wasn’t the ultimate cause of Pearl Harbor, the Japanese attack cemented how untenable isolationism is.

America was and remains the world’s most powerful country, and because of this, its citizens have been granted untold privilege, both economically and politically. This status though is not God-given but earned. Should America choose to retreat there will always be a challenger looking to swoop in, and use the advantage gained to strengthen its position vis-a-vis America.

Ignoring the world’s problems may be a short-term solution for cost-cutting, but eventually, those chickens will come home to roost, and when they do, they won’t do so quietly.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Expert witness testifies Canadian shop teacher with gargantuan fake boobs is, in 'fact,' a woman
entries.description:
An "expert" witness recently testified that Kayla Lemieux, the Canadian teacher with the ginormous fake boobs is indeed a woman, and should have access to all-female spaces.

In case you need a refresher or would like to subject your eyeballs to extreme pain, here is the video of Lemieux that went viral last year:

\u201cRemember: safety first! @Henrik_Palmgren @LanaLokteff\u201d
— Rambo, John J (@Rambo, John J) 1663302142

The expert testimony came during a trial for a Canadian nurse who could lose her license for expressing "transphobic" opinions, such as women are female and men don't belong in female spaces. This alone would be shocking, but it is Canada, so it checks out.

The expert, professor of epidemiology and biostatistics Dr. Greta Bauer, was cross-examined on the concept of autogynephilia. This is a term used to describe a straight man who is aroused by the thought of themself as a woman. The sexologist behind the term, Ray Blanchard, said that the majority of men who medically transition to females fall into this category.

Bauer said the issue with this theory is it would assume all trans-lesbians are fetishists, which is not the case. All this LGBTQAEIPP-2S mumbo jumbo can get confusing, so a quick clarification: by "trans lesbian," she means a biological man who is attracted to a biological woman. Carry on.

If there were ever an example of a man who appears to get off on dressing like a woman, it would be Kayla Lemieux. There's just no other reasonable explanation to willingly subject yourself to boobs that large with such problematically protruding nipples. But when Bauer was specifically asked about Lemieux, she simply said he is a woman and should have access to all female spaces, as per the law.

A theory has been floated that Lemieux actually hates woke culture and is donning the ginormous knockers as a form of protest.

\u201cIs the Canadian giant boobs teacher a fetishist - or actually trolling? And does it even make any difference? Me at @unherd on satire and the new moral hegemony: https://t.co/ttRGtcg4Py\u201d
— Mary Harrington (@Mary Harrington) 1664183949

If this is the case, it's a pretty good troll. He'd be forcing the school to abide by their own standards and pointing out just how insane those standards are. But given that he hasn't publicly spoken out against the culture, AND he went sky-diving with a porn star, humungous boobs and all...it seems unlikely.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Ron DeSantis tells DC where to stick a gas stove ban while media attempts to gaslight (pun intended) on the issue
entries.description:
News broke this week that the Biden Administration was looking at banning gas stoves. We can confirm that at a press briefing, Karine Jean-Pierre assured Americans Joe Biden has no plans to do so. Now, YOU can decide how much you trust this administration. But for the sake of accuracy, I have to report the White House said these words.

One person who does not trust the administration's truthiness on the matter is America's Governor and (God willing) Joe's opponent in 2024, Ron DeSantis. Or, DeSantis was just having a little fun.

"When we say Don't Tread on Florida... we mean that, including on your gas stoves!

You're not taking our gas stoves away from us!" - @RonDeSantisFL 🔥💪 pic.twitter.com/c1tKAk2hHl
— Team DeSantis 🐊 (@teamrondesantis) January 12, 2023
When we say Don't Tread on Florida... we mean that, including on your gas stoves! You're not taking our gas stoves away from us!

Corporate media would prefer to pretend the whole ordeal is misinformation. Axios, citing "officials," claim the ban is unfounded. But those silly conservatives are getting all culture war'y about it anyway. The media is doing actual gaslighting on a gas stove issue.

I wish I could take credit for that pun. If you are reading this and are the first person to use "gaslighting" in reference to this story, please take a bow.

Despite official insistence that fears of a ban are unfounded, conservatives are suddenly championing gas stoves in a new culture war.https://t.co/wE4COctSJR
— Axios (@axios) January 12, 2023

Follow along, because I notice a familiar pattern.

Conservatives react to something that is in the "legitimate" media. It was Bloomberg, not the Liberty Eagle Freedom MAGA Gazette, that first reported about a potential gas stove ban. Like Axios, we're told to believe Bloomberg is legitimate media.

Leftists lash out and attempt to make the issue their own, attacking those silly anti-science rubes who don't realize that your gas stove could literally kill you and all your loved ones literally. This was done on CNN and by social media influencers like Rep. AOC.

The White House issued a denial once they received a negative response.

"Legitimate" media outlets like Axios act as if it's unfounded that conservatives wouldn't take the Biden Adminstration at their word. Also unfounded is the belief that if there is someone talking about this in the administration, there are enough people who think it's a good idea. And that Joe Biden will support whatever the people who run Joe Biden tell him to.

There is NO REASON to believe Democrats would sneak a gas stove regulation into larger, unrelated bills like it's a $600 Venmo tax. To say otherwise is misinformation.

Misinformation that was started by the media, who now claims you're the one spreading misinformation with your concern. You see how that works?

Editor’s Note

entries.title: WATCH: Doocy quotes Biden verbatim on classified docs, leaves Karine Jean-Pierre completely flabbergasted
entries.description:
Yesterday, we discussed Peter Doocy grilling Karine Jean-Pierre on why President Biden has confidence in Mayor Pete Buttigieg. There were a few more golden nuggets from that press conference that definitely deserve their time in the limelight--all from Pete Doocy, of course, who seems to be the only remaining journalist at the White House.

Doocy quoted Biden's own words about Trump taking classified documents, leaving Karine Jean-Pierre completely speechless.

\u201cKJP gets left speechless as Peter Doocy quotes Joe Biden's own words back to her.\u201d
— Townhall.com (@Townhall.com) 1673474098

Doocy also asked KJP how Biden can be trusted with America's secrets, given that he had a secret stash of highly sensitive documents buried in a closet. She claimed he can be trusted because his "lawyers did the right thing" and he "was surprised" by the discovery.

\u201cDOOCY: "How can President Biden be trusted moving forward with America's secrets?"\n\nKJP: "Because his lawyers, his team did the right thing."\u201d
— Townhall.com (@Townhall.com) 1673467816

Ah yes, I forgot that being surprised by a committed crime totally exonerates you of any and all malfeasance. It's always quite shocking, but also hilarious, how unprepared Karine Jean-Pierre is for extremely predictable questions.

Last night, this story got even worse for Biden when news broke of a SECOND batch of discovered documents. It sure is convenient this news is breaking now, and not when the first documents were discovered right before the midterm elections!

Biden's aides reportedly discovered the second batch while searching "a location that Biden was known to use after leaving office as vice president." There's no information yet on what the second batch of documents contained, but the first round contained intelligence memos on Ukraine, Iran, and the United Kingdom, which Biden may not have had the authority to take as Vice President. Oops!

It's not known yet if the search is complete, so there could be a few more rounds of documents discovered before this story is promptly swept under the rug and never spoken of again. All while Trump gets prosecuted for the exact same thing, of course.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: As gun-toting hero faces grand jury, the taqueria he saved gets robbed AGAIN five days later
entries.description:
A gun-toting hero who saved the day turned himself in. And the restaurant he saved wound up getting robbed less than a week later anyway.

To recap, earlier this week we told you about a punk who f*cked around with a fake gun and found out what happened when a bystander/samaritan had a real one.

Terrible things happen while doing terrible things, especially while trying to rob an entire restaurant with people with a fake gun.

A customer in Houston TX at a taqueria restaurant shot and killed the would be robber after stealing everyone’s money and wallets. @fox26houston pic.twitter.com/oT6Mdil8TR
— Carl Ducena (@Carlducena) January 7, 2023
The shooter collected the stolen money from the robber and returned it to the other patrons, police said. Then the rest of the people in the restaurant left the scene before the police arrived.

The shooter has since turned himself in and has been cooperating with authorities. He wasn't arrested or charged with anything, so his identity is being kept private. His attorney issued a statement about his client enjoying dinner when the incident occurred.

In fear of his life and his friend’s life my client acted to protect everyone in the restaurant. In Texas, a shooting is justified in self-defense, defense of others and in defense of property.

The case will go before a Grand Jury when the investigation is done. Short of someone on the jury being a gun control zealot or a social justice activist, the man should be in the clear.

Then, on an unrelated note, that same taqueria was robbed AGAIN five days later. In the middle of the night, a thief broke in and stole $100 from slot machines. Pedo Lopez, owner of El Ranchito #4, says that robberies are common.

The little we do have we take home because it's been several times they've broken in. I feel bad. I don't know how to take care of myself or from which direction we'll be hit.

If I could offer a suggestion, the guy who saved your customers five days early has a pretty good idea of how to take care of yourself.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Watch: TikTok influencer takes swing at Las Vegas bouncers, discovers they don't care he's a TikTok influencer
entries.description:
I admit to not knowing much about who Bryce Hall is. Or caring. He's a TikTok influencer. He was part of either Sway or Hype House, which are both things. The kids think he's the cat's pajamas, and that's fine. I liked stupid things when I was a kid too.

What I do know is I have a lot of friends who were bouncers, and always enjoyed the wannabe tough guys trying to step to them. Seeing video of a punk getting rag-dolled for not being as big of a badass as he pretends to be on Chinese spyware is satisfying.

Before I hurt you … Don’t touch me. Don’t f*cking touch me.

TMZ reports it is unclear what got Hall tossed from the club, other than being invited up to the DJ booth. After a disagreement with a bouncer, he took a swing. After he took a swing, the bouncer and his colleagues had their excuse.

Hall is being charged with two counts of battery and one of trespassing, and the case is being submitted to the District Attorney. At which point a huge sack of money will be left somewhere and all will be fine.

I disagree with the framing that it "took" four security guards to take Bryce Hall down. One could handle him fine. The other three joined it because it looked like fun.

Anytime I see TikTok influencer drama like this, I think of an infamous Andrew Schulz rant about influencers being "worthless to society." And how the China version of Bryce Hall would be a kid who is a science and engineering wiz.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Couple attempts to rob a gas station with a gun, gets foiled by customers who had three guns
entries.description:
Call it regional stereotyping. But if I'm in the south, I assume everyone around me has a gun. If I found myself in a position where I was holding up a gas station with a gun, that would be in the back of my mind. It wasn't for this couple, who found out the hard way that three other customers in the gas station also had firearms. Key difference: theirs were legal.

So it's a good guy with a gun stopping a bad guy with a gun. Times three.

Meet Shawn and Melody Sutton. Shawn is the one with a beard. They are the couple who attempted to rob a North Georgia gas station. Melody waited in the getaway car. Shawn "wrapped a pair of women’s underwear around his neck and face" and proceeded to pull a gun on the cashier.

As we've discussed this week, ALWAYS LOOK OUT BEHIND YOU. Maybe the panties on his head blocked his peripheral vision because Shawn missed there were other customers in the store. He pulled a gun and said, "this is a stick-up." Three different customers pulled THEIR guns and said "the f*ck it is!"

WSB-TV reports when police arrived on the scene, Sutton refused to comply. So he found himself on the wrong end of a stun gun.

Shawn faces charges of "armed robbery, aggravated assault, and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon." Shocker, this was not Shawn's first offense.

Melody faces charges of "armed robbery, intimidation, and taking control of a substance." Shocker, drugs were involved too.

The three gun-owning samaritans took their guns and their legal permits and went along their merry way.

The Left Wants to Ban Guns that Don't Exist... | Louder With Crowder youtu.be

entries.title: Watch: Deer decides meat is murder, commits act of civil disobedience by crashing into butcher shop
entries.description:
Humans who protest and vandalize in the name of not eating meat deserve our ridicule and mockery. They should also chow down on a cheeseburger once in a while. It would put them in a better mood. But while we point and laugh at humans, I can understand why the meat itself would take exception to being food. Like this doe or deer (a female deer) vandalizing a butcher shop.

The deer came barrelling through a glass door like it was a prison break.

The buck stops here! Wild moment deer crashes through butcher's door youtu.be

The deer's name is Kramer. That's what we're calling it.

The best part of the video is hearing someone screaming in the background "why is there a deer here?"

I think the answer is simple. It was there to send a message. Walk in. F*ck shit up. Leave. That's literally what the dear did. It wrecked something off-camera. Then it left the way it came. Message received.

Melissa Evans, owner of the She Said Butcher Shop, posted to Facebook that she wasn't sure who was more terrified: her, or the deer?

Other than a smashed door, a hole in the wall and a few broken plants, everything else came out unscathed and I am thankful, because it could have been so much worse, not only with damages, but potentially could have seriously hurt someone.

Kramer has allies in her(?) mission, who of course were quick to blame the butcher shop for the act of domestic terrorism committed against it.

That's right. It's the shop's fault for not anticipating a ruminant mammal would come crashing through the front door and leave a safety mat out for it.

The butcher shop was closed temporarily for repairs. If you see Kramer, I'm not sure what the local hunting rules are but if you happen to have a bow and arrow handy, the She Said Butcher Shop might work out a deal with you.
